title.narrative: 2.1 ACCESS TO EDUCATION

description.narrative: Children especially those vulnerable have expanded access to basic education, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable participation in and completion of quality, inclusive education

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)

System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children especially those vulnerable have expanded access to basic education

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the inclusion of more than 20,000 children from vulnerable groups in education, including refugee children, those out of school and those with disabilities. UNICEF strengthened the capacity of government, partners and schools to make the education system and school environments more inclusive of children from vulnerable groups. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/10/2018
